verb.description: Admit or state that one has committed a crime or is at fault in some way.
examples: he confessed that he had attacked the old man
he wants to confess to Caroline's murder
once apprehended, they would confess their guilt

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French confesser, from Latin confessus, past participle of confiteri acknowledge, from con- (expressing intensive force) + fateri declare, avow.
